author: Markus B
comment: READ BEFORE BUYING: If you buy the full app, it won't work without also subscribing their server connection. Without that you can only use the app when all devices are connected to same wifi.  On the free version different networks worked really nicely and for free, so I think this is really sneaky Business!

author: Jenna Kirsch
comment: Emailed company regarding app. It's really poor video quality when it works. Costs extra if you use it on more than one "network" and never got help after emailing about app. Got automated response. Emailing to try to get my money back. Waste of money and time

author: sebastian
comment: I can monitor my baby on random basis, one time baby's phone is grayed out, another shown as active, it's inconsistent and not user-friendly, I should either see the message pointing the problem, otherwise it should be possible to monitor, we have it on 2 iPhones and 2 android phones which we switch depending on the needs. We need to switch between parent devices and it doesn't come handy. From current perspective not worth the price.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the review. We'd be happy if you expanded on your opinions or contacted us with your issues at support@anniebabymonitor.com  and we'll be happy to help you any way we can.

author: Adam Barney
comment: Think it's good based on two days use between an iPad and an Android phone. Drops occasionally and the sensitivity is a little wild but all in all a solid cross platform monitor to use from a hotel lobby to a room that is not dependent on being on the same WiFi. Paid extra for the family plan and will continue to use in the future

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Thanks, Adam. We're glad you found Annie Baby Monitor useful.

author: David Wise
comment: It is constantly disconnecting and unreliable. The video and audio quality is poor. Note, it will not monitor if you turn on Netflix. Can't trust it.

author: David Kim
comment: Poor video quality.  When connecting devices, one baby one parent, video always stops after 2 minutes.  IPad to android sharing video sucks bad.  I guess they hate each other.

author: Niko Roos
comment: Good app! Works and does it's job.  BUT! I paid 10€ for this app and now I need a subscription. Not mentioned before. I know you need to earn money. But common, with existing user base?

author: Jacob Eckel
comment: Constant disconnects on local net, misleading interface, not worth the price.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hey Jacob, thanks for the review, we're working on improving the app, so we value all feedback. If you have any problems or would like to expand on your opinion, let us know at support@anniebabymonitor.com

author: Erik Artschwager
comment: Bought on iPhone and installed on android as second device. License is gone now for some reason after installing an update...

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, we'd really like to get the app going for you. Please, contact our support at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll help you.

author: Kimberley Morrison
comment: rubbish not worth the money offered free license for the updated version and that's worse

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Sorry you feel this way, Kimberley. We'd be happy if you contacted us at support@anniebabymonitor.com with your problems or perhaps a detailed explanation of your issue with the app. We'll do our best to help you.

author: Matt Bailey
comment: Paid for monthly subscription but at the end of the trial hour it stopped working.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Matt, we're very sorry about that. Let us fix it! E-mail us with you login e-mail at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll take care of it.

author: Fredrik Lied Larsen
comment: Buggy and expensive.

author: Caitlin Perszyk
comment: Paid for one week and it said our trial ended after 1hr

author: Eyal Aharoni
comment: Won't connect Android to iPhone

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, all platforms that Annie runs on (Android, iOS, Mac, and Windows) are connectable. If you have these problems, please, contact our support at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we will help you set it up. Thank you for letting us know.

author: Roderick de Leeuw
comment: Paid app that 'hides' as a free one. Looks really good though.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Roderick, thanks. You can watch your babies for free on your local network. If you have any additional questions or  need help with something, let us know at support@anniebabymonitor.com.

author: Angel Solomon
comment: Doesn't work

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: I'm sorry that the app doesn't work for you, Angel. Could you let us know the details? We'd love to help you!

author: Jonathan Dybkjær
comment: Just simply doesn't work. Limited 30 minute trial.

author: Zohre Sanaei
comment: It has tons of cool feature but they are not working! It looks like developer is more worried about licensing that functionality. I install parent one on my iPhone and child on Android, the connection gets off and it has background noise. Very loud noise in both sides. Uninstalled it

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Contact our support at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll help you set the app up and help you with any questions you might have.

author: Vee Ann Tan
comment: Works well unless, like me, you want to use your old phone both as a baby unit and a white noise machine - white noise (played via a different app) is muted when devices are connected. Obviously this is not ideal as I have to intermittently connect to the child unit just to check on him, then disconnect so the white noise plays again. Unfortunately I had already paid for the full version before discovering this or I would have tried another app instead.

author: Darien Aguayo
comment: Bad quality, kept saying he was awake when he wasn't, and the connection wasn't that great either from my iPhone 6+ to s8+

author: Edwin Neo
comment: Inconsistent connection even while on the same WiFi network. We paid for the full version and then they hit us for a subscription. It might be alright even with the subscription fees... If it actually worked.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Edwin, thanks for the feedback. I'm sorry you're not happy with the app.Contact us at support@anniebabymonitor.com and I'm sure we can help you find a solution to your problems.

author: william vega
comment: Really bad app couldn't get it to work

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Contact support@anniebabymonitor.com for help with the app.

author: Joliette Lange
comment: Decent app. Fairly easy to use. The only issue I had was that it seems to disable video recording in all other apps.  When I uninstalled Annie my phone's camera could video record again.  It's a pain to have to uninstall every time I want to record a video.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback. What you're talking about seems unusual a definitely should not happen. Please contact our at support@anniebabymonitor.com and the developers will look into it. Thanks again for giving us feedback, we appreciate it!

author: Jara Beneitez
comment: I've been using the (paid version) app for a week with an android phone and an iPhone and it has worked very well. We have been using it over 4g with only a medium strength connection and on the few occasions that it has lost connection it has notified us. Before leaving baby unattended for the first time, you should check the sensitivity setting (also do an experiment) and the notification settings of both phones. You don't want the phone to wake baby up with Facebook notifications! Overall, very happy. I can't think of improvements.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Thank you, Jara, for your kind words. We'll keep on working on the app to make it even better!

author: Paul Johnson
comment: Paid £10 and cannot get the app to work. Tried 3 different devices without joy. Don't buy, cannot be trusted

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Paul, thanks for your feedback. I'm sorry you couldn't get the app to work for you. Contact our support at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll help you sort out any connectivity issues.

author: Martina Daviz
comment: Don't use it as a copy is virus Christ amaze when you download its over and get information and give you a virus on your phone and monitor you're so long to get garbage they want to monitor your credit card and record you

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hello, thanks for your feedback. Our app is definitely not a virus, nor will it infect your phone or any other device you want to use. We work hard to create top notch apps that help parents all over the world. If you found any problem or if you need help, contact us at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we can help you sort it out.

author: Amit Kumar
comment: You guys should mention it in the app that it's a trial version,  took ages to connect.

author: Melissa Chang
comment: Can't figure out how to turn off. I closed the app and I still see notification.

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Melissa, if you have any problems or issues with the app, contact our 24/7 support at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll help you there :)

author: Iacio Umbra
comment: Tried to use as a pet monitor. Whilst the interface works it takes a lot of movement and noise for it to alert you that the animal is awake, so I assume it would be the same with a baby. I had to swing the monitoring camera 90 degrees before it said the dog was awake. I danced in front of it for 30 seconds and it didn't notice a thing! The live stream, however, did work over 4g and the microphone worked well.

author: shellejo
comment: Frustrated, uninstalled after numerous attempts to use. Locking up ...Fail again & again

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, thanks for your review. If you have problems using the app, let us know at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll find a solution.

author: Angela Tejada
comment: I found this app which i do love but they should offer at least a 1 week trail to get the hang of this because you waist the trail time on figuring out how to work the damn thing....but i did love it and if it wasnt for that trail time I'd probably rate it higher.....

The app seems ok but definitely should have a longer trial,my daughter slept for this 30min and I couldn t really see if it is worth to buy the app!also the video on the parent device wasn t a full image and it was blurry,not sure why as on my baby one it did show a full image!

author: Roy M
comment: It should say trial version in the description. Poor on your part.

author: Swa Su
comment: Disconnects as soon as the devices are connected to different networks, which makes it useless for me. I love, love, love it when it does work (when still in our own WiFi zone). Please fix! I want to use it so badly, and it's super important that it works even when the two devices are in two different WiFi networks (baby device in our own, parent device in our neighbours'). Otherwise I could use my traditional Graco baby monitor and wouldn't need this app at all. Edit: Must have certain ports open in your network for this to work. Wish there was a diagnostics option on android. It works great as long as the needed ports are not blocked, even across networks.

author: Natalie Kearney
comment: This is probably the best one I found yet. Although, why is the video so blurry? It didn't do that with other apps. My camera is fine. Everything else works great. I feel like I will buy it but only if I figure this camera video issue. I can't see it clear

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, thanks for your review. What devices and networks are you using? Do you have the settings set to the highest possible video quality? Let us know at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll take a look at it for you.

author: daisy seven
comment: Cool idea but not sure why I can't see or hear my baby 😒 it just keeps saying loading video. There's no sound and it's not allowing me to click anything . And it's using my time to load the video so by the time it's done I won't even get to try this out. Sofar it's a hard fail

author: Frank Bertele
comment: The free trial worked fine. Once I paid for the premium account it stopped working and I got several error messages. Bad luck or scam?

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, we're sorry, we're not trying to scam you in any way. Please email us either at support@anniebabyonitor.com or message us on Facebook and we'll sort it out.

author: kathryn busse
comment: Always disconnected! Like 90% of the time despite an iPhone and Samsung plus strong wifi. A bad lag whenever I try to quickly turn on the light to view, so the flashlight stays on. Sound effect for "disconnected" is the same for "baby is awake". Not worth it even if it was free. App needs work.

author: Joey Smith
comment: This app is stupid, wouldn't even show me a video when I connected my devices. Don't waste your time with this garbage!

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi Joey, we're very sorry Annie Baby Monitor doesn't seem to work for you. Please, if you experience technical difficulties, contact us at support@anniebabymonitor.com or message us on facebook. We're sure we can help you.

author: Lucia Farkasova
comment: It worked fine until I bought full version. Now connection issues appear all the times

reply.author: Master App Solutions
reply.content: Hi, I'm sorry you're having connectivity issues but it should have no connection to the version of the app you have. Contact us at support@anniebabymonitor.com and we'll take a look at it for you. Take care!
